DOC.brief_summary: Aim : Determine overall effectiveness target digital messaging intervention improve colorectal cancer ( CRC ) screen rate compare care usual . Hypothesis : Screening rate higher patient receive digital messaging intervention , compare control group patient receive care usual .
DOC.brief_title: Regional Native American Community Networks Program ( RNACNP )
DOC.detailed_description: Native People Cancer Control one project Partnerships Native Health , 1 23 Community Networks Programs fund National Cancer Institute . The aim Native People Cancer Control reduce cancer health disparity conduct training , research , education outreach , collaboration American Indian Alaska Native community . We work partnership Native people , community , organization 8-state area , include : Alaska , Washington , Wyoming , Oregon , Idaho , Montana , North Dakota , South Dakota . Our program consist 4 core : Administrative Core : assist grant administration , budget , sub-contracts Tribes , program planning , report . Outreach/Education Core : assist cancer education , outreach , health promotion , cancer prevention activity among urban rural AI/AN people . Training Core : build capacity Native faculty-level investigator , student , conduct research . Research Core : conduct community-based participatory research colorectal cancer screen , health literacy , health communication , cancer risk factor among American Indian Alaska Native people . The main research project Native People Cancer Control title , `` Innovations Enhancing Colorectal Cancer Screening '' . The goal project develop , implement , evaluate community wide , multi-media campaign improve colorectal cancer screen among American Indians Alaska Natives 3 community .
